note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: Constructor misnamed as DynamicPyramid instead of Rubixi, is a public function allowing anyone to reset creator and gain owner privileges

Unchecked arithmetic: additions and multiplications (e.g. msg.value * pyramidMultiplier in addPayout, _amt *= 1 ether) can overflow on large inputs, and in collectPercentOfFees dividing before multiplying (collectedFees / 100 * _pcent) leads to precision loss.
Multiple .send() calls whose return values are not checked, leading to potential silent failures of Ether transfers

The unnamed fallback function is not marked payable (line 39), so any Ether sent to the contract reverts, blocking all participation. Additionally, the while‐loop in addPayout (starting line 72) is unbounded and may exhaust gas, preventing new entrants from ever completing a transaction.

The contract uses a FIFO participant queue (participants.push) in addPayout, and entry order directly affects payout priority. An attacker observing a pending deposit can send a higher‐gas transaction to be mined first, gaining an earlier position in the participants array and a more favorable payout order.
No msg.data length check before reading the address parameter, allowing a crafted short address payload to shift arguments
Floating pragma declaration (`pragma solidity ^0.4.15;`) allows compilation with different compiler versions which may introduce inconsistent or unexpected behavior
